snippet: Sponsors and fans express shock at domestic-abuse accusations involving players but still thrill to the collisions on the field, which leave players with lasting damage.
abstract: Michael Powell Sports of the Times column observes that companies like Anheuser-Busch that are expressing outrage over domestic violence in the NFL do not seem to be bothered by the life-changing on-field violence that is an inherent part of the game; holds that it is hard to have faith in moral declarations from companies that are so deeply entwined in the multibillion dollar football industry.
lead_paragraph: Sponsors and fans express shock at domestic-abuse accusations involving players but still thrill to the collisions on the field, which leave players with lasting damage.

headline.seo: Reactions to Adrian Peterson Case Ignore Brutality on N.F.L. Fields
headline.main: Outrage Over Violence Ends at the Stadium Gates
headline.print_headline: Outrage Over Violence Ends at the Stadium Gates
